Usage¶

Installation¶

To use Project, first clone the git repository to your computer from here and then run:

$ scripts/install.sh

Uploading thoughts¶

To run the server you can use the project.run_server(address, data_dir) function:

project.run_server(address, data_dir)¶

Runs a server that serves some data directory. Can be stopped by Ctrl+C.

Parameters:

  • address (str) – A host and a port, e.g.: 127.0.0.1:5000.

  • data_dir (str ot Path-like objects) – A path to the data directory the server will serve.

To upload a thought you can use the project.upload_thought(address, user_id, thought) function:

project.upload_thought(address, user_id, thought)¶

Upload some thought of some user to the server.

Parameters:

  • address (str) – A host and a port, e.g.: 127.0.0.1:5000.

  • user_id (str) – The user Id, e.g. 2

  • thought (str) – The thought the the user had.

To run the server you can use the project.run_server(address, data_dir) function:

project.run_webserver(address, data_dir)¶

Creates a web page for the server that serves some data directory in which the user numbers can be found, and each one of them holds the thoughts of this user. Currently works only for at most 5 users.

Parameters:

  • address (str) – A host and a port, e.g.: 127.0.0.1:5000.

  • data_dir (str ot Path-like objects) – A path to the data directory the server will serve.

Every thought is represented by the project.Tought class:

class project.Thought(user_id, timestamp, thought)¶

A class representing a thought.
